trans-unit.source: Represents a parameter that is used for master-detail filters in which a data source gets information from another data control.
The <xref:System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicControlParameter> object is used in the `Where` parameters collection of the data source control's query.
The parameter object automatically filters by primary key or foreign keys between the two controls and supports multi-part keys automatically.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicControlParameter"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicControlParameter"></xref> class, bound to the specified control.
The ID of the control whose values the parameter represents.
Gets or sets the unique identifier of the control that the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicControlParameter"></xref> object binds to.
The unique identifier of the control from which the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicControlParameter"></xref> object gets its data.
Throws an <xref href="System.InvalidOperationException"></xref> exception to indicate that the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicDataManager"></xref> control is missing.
This method should not be called by the page developer.
A <xref href="System.InvalidOperationException"></xref> object that indicates the <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.DynamicDataManager"></xref> control is missing.
Returns the collection of parameters that are used to create a `Where` clause for when the data source is queried.
The <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.IDynamicDataSource"></xref> instance to get the parameters from.

A collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Parameter"></xref> objects that represent the query parameters for the specified <xref href="System.Web.DynamicData.IDynamicDataSource"></xref> instance.
